title.value: Towards Foundational Models for Molecular Learning on Large-Scale Multi-Task Datasets
title.justification: This is the title as given in the research paper header.
title.quote: T OWARDS F OUNDATIONAL M ODELS FOR M OLECULAR L EARNING ON L ARGE -S CALE M ULTI -TASK DATASETS

extractions.description: This paper addresses the challenges of developing foundation models in molecular machine learning due to the lack of large, hand-curated labeled datasets. It introduces seven novel datasets segmented into three categories: ToyMix, LargeMix, and UltraLarge, covering nearly 100 million molecules and over 3000 tasks, totaling over 13 billion labels of quantum and biological nature. It presents the Graphium graph machine learning library to facilitate molecular learning on these extensive datasets and provides baseline results to illustrate the potential of multi-task and multi-level learning.

type.justification: The paper is classified as an empirical study because it presents datasets, a library for modeling, and empirically demonstrates multi-task learning with baseline results.
type.quote: this study advances molecular research ... Second, we describe a graph machine learning library called Graphium to facilitate efficient training on these extensive datasets... Third, a range of baseline models are implemented

name.justification: The paper focuses on molecular datasets and machine learning models for molecules.
name.quote: datasets with labeled features, and codebases to manage those datasets, has hindered the development of foundation models. In this work, we present seven novel datasets... These datasets push the boundaries in both the scale and the diversity of supervised labels for molecular learning

name.justification: The paper discusses graph neural networks for molecular data representation and learning.
name.quote: Graph learning models have been a key component in the recent successes of machine learning in drug discovery... These methods have demonstrated considerable performance in molecular representation learning

name.justification: The paper emphasizes multi-task learning approaches for molecular datasets.
name.quote: Finally, we present a range of baseline results as a starting point of multi-task and multi-level training on these datasets

name.justification: The paper includes datasets and properties related to quantum chemistry for molecule modeling.
name.quote: These datasets have been designed for the supervised training of foundation models by combining labels representing quantum and biological properties

name.justification: MoleculeNet is mentioned in the context of molecular datasets.
name.quote: Several molecular datasets are available for node- and graph-level supervised learning tasks. A few notable examples are MoleculeNet (Wu et al., 2018)

is_contributed.justification: MoleculeNet is not a contribution of this paper but is referenced as an existing dataset.
is_contributed.quote: Several molecular datasets are available for node- and graph-level supervised learning tasks. A few notable examples are MoleculeNet (Wu et al., 2018)

is_executed.justification: The execution or implementation details of MoleculeNet are not provided in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Several molecular datasets are available for node- and graph-level supervised learning tasks. A few notable examples are MoleculeNet (Wu et al., 2018)

is_compared.justification: MoleculeNet is not compared numerically; it is referenced as a notable example.
is_compared.quote: Several molecular datasets are available for node- and graph-level supervised learning tasks. A few notable examples are MoleculeNet (Wu et al., 2018)

referenced_paper_title.value: MoleculeNet: A Benchmark for Molecular Machine Learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper by Wu et al., 2018, which introduced MoleculeNet, is cited.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Several molecular datasets are available for node- and graph-level supervised learning tasks. A few notable examples are MoleculeNet (Wu et al., 2018)

name.justification: ToyMix is a combination of smaller datasets used for fast iterations of molecular models.
name.quote: Firstly, we propose a smaller T OY M IX dataset to enable fast iterations of the architecture while also providing valuable insight

name.justification: LargeMix is a mix of large, well-curated datasets including quantum and biological tasks.
name.quote: Secondly, we propose the L ARGE M IX, a mix of well-curated datasets with data for millions of chemical compounds over thousands of biological or quantum labels

name.justification: UltraLarge is the most extensive dataset compilation in the study, aiming to push the limits of molecular dataset scales.
name.quote: Finally, we propose the ultra-large PM6_83M dataset, which pushes the limit of dataset scale with over 12 billion labels defined for 83 million molecules

name.justification: This dataset is mentioned as a comparison point to highlight the scale of the new datasets being introduced.
name.quote: In comparison, our datasets contain 300 times more data points than the widely used OGB-LSC PCQM4Mv2 dataset, and 13 times more than the quantum-only QM1B dataset

referenced_paper_title.value: OGB-LSC: A Large-Scale Challenge for Machine Learning on Graphs
referenced_paper_title.justification: The title is provided in the references of the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In comparison, our datasets contain 300 times more data points than the widely used OGB-LSC PCQM4Mv2 dataset

name.justification: The Graphium library is introduced in this research as a tool to support molecular machine learning.
name.quote: To support the development of foundational models based on our proposed datasets, we present the Graphium graph machine learning library which simplifies the process of building and training molecular machine learning models for multi-task and multi-level molecular datasets
